intro: Satureja innota, commonly known as mountain thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, forming compact clusters at the ends of the stems. The essential oils extracted from its leaves contain compounds like thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its medicinal and aromatic properties.
